intro: Thelasis hongkongensis, commonly known as the Hong Kong thelasis, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Rubiaceae. It is native to Hong Kong and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and woody stems. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as forests or rocky areas. Its leaves are usually elliptical with a smooth texture and a slightly glossy surface. Thelasis hongkongensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
